9. CMA 2025 #148 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of 40,625 received from the Metropolitan Mayors Coalition’s Community Safety Initiative through the Executive Office of Public Safety and Security to the Grant Fund Police Department Salary and Wages account ($32,025) and the Grant Fund Police Department Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($8,600). Funds will be dedicated to hot spot patrols, youth violence reduction strategies, and the Focused Deterrence program. The Other Ordinary Maintenance allocation will support a Teen Public Art program “Upcycling and Entrepreneurialism” through the Community Art Center. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout

II. Policy Order and Resolution List
1. POR 2025 #84 : That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to determine whether the City Council can revoke an already approved curb cut application if said application was incomplete due to applicant failure. Order Adopted [6 to 1]
Policy Order Printout
2. POR 2025 #85 : That the City Manager is requested to work with the City Clerk, the Information Technology Department, the Law Department, and any other relevant departments to draft an ordinance establishing the City of Cambridge Electronic Records Archiving Policy. Order Adopted as Amended [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
3. POR 2025 #86 : Policy Order urging Governor Healey, the MBTA Board of Directors and General Manager Phillip Eng to amend the MBTA Alewife Station Complex redevelopment RFP to include as a priority eliminating untreated Combined Sewer Overflow (CSO) sewage in our neighborhoods by incorporating green and gray infrastructure as central components of the project. The order further calls on the MBTA to collaborate with the MWRA, DCR, DPH, the City of Cambridge, and the community to address this public health threat. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY MAYOR SIMMONS IN COUNCIL JUNE 9, 2025 Charter Right
Policy Order Printout
a. Photos for POR on Alewife Sewage v2
b. Councillor Nolan Amendment by substitution language in Council June 9
c. CSO PO Amendment
4. POR 2025 #87 : City Council support of H2634: An Act relative to sexual assault by an officer. Order Adopted [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout
III. Calendar
Charter Right
1. POR 2025 #80 : That the exception language in Chapter 2.129.040 Section J of the Cambridge Municipal Code be revised with language clarifying that Cambridge city employees shall not participate in federal immigration enforcement operations and that the sole role of Cambridge city employees during any action by ICE is only to protect public safety and not to assist or facilitate the work of ICE. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER. Order Adopted as Amended [Unanimous]
Policy Order Printout

VIII. Communications and Reports from Other City Officers
1. COF 2025 #94 : A communication was received from Paula Crane, Interim City Clerk, transmitting an update regarding legislative activity. PLACED ON FILE [Unanimous]
Communication and Report from Other City Officers Printout
a. Updated Hearing Schedule 6.4.2025
b. PENDING HOME RULE PETITIONS JUNE 9, 2025
c. 2024-2025 Committee Referral List
d. Pending Zoning Petitions and Municipal Ordinances Chart
Appended Information
Awaiting Report Status Update
ARS-25-17 : Awaiting Report Status Update 06.09.25
a. Updated Awaiting Report & Policy Order Status U... (25)
Awaiting Report List
2. AR-24-64 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to prepare a Home Rule Petition to enact legislation which would allow the City of Cambridge to prohibit associations from unreasonably restricting the use of a solar energy system.
3. AR-25-3 : The City Manager is requested to report back to the City Council with a update on the status and timeline for the completion of the Grand Junction Multiuse Path and how implementation between Gore Street and Little Binney could coincide with Phase 2 of the CSO implementation on Cambridge Street.
4. AR-25-5 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to prepare a report on the use of M.G.L. Ch. 40U to determine which local statutes can be enforced by the local-option procedure in order to better collect fines in violation of Cambridge ordinances and provide a recommendation to the City Council for implementation of Ch. 40U procedures.
5. AR-25-12 : The City Manager is requested to work with all appropriate Departments to develop language to create an “Affordable Rent Incentive Program” program for Cambridge and to report back to the City Council with option, including the percentage of possible tax abatements.
6. AR-25-15 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant departments to create a plaque to be placed at the entrance of or inside City Hall that demonstrates the values that the Cambridge City Council upholds of the separation of church and state and gender equality.
7. AR-25-20 : That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department to develop a timeline for the next Incentive Zoning Nexus Study.
8. AR-25-24 : That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to do more outreach to residents, businesses, and property owners to communicate the drought status and take all measures to reduce nonessential water use citywide, and provide a report on citywide water usage and water supply. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
9. AR-25-25 : That the City Manager is requested to establish a Lost and Found program at Cambridge City Hall. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
10. AR-25-26 : That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department to assemble a list of public and private spaces available to the public, indoors and outdoors, noting contact information and any associated requirements, ensuring that there are public meeting places identified in each neighborhood.
11. AR-25-27 : That the City Manager investigate bike pod storage options to be placed in suitable areas in the City to provide residents and visitors safe storage options.
12. AR-25-28 : That the City Manager is requested to prepare an update with details on the status of potential civilian flagger operations in the Cambridge police union contract and work with relevant city staff to explore a civilian traffic flagger program and update the current police union contract on the City's website.
13. AR-25-30 : The City Manager is requested to confer with the Community Development Department to develop a timeline for the next Inclusionary Housing Study, explore remedies to address the lack of housing starts and provide for consideration draft amendments to the Inclusionary Housing Ordinance, and explore other incentives to encourage developers to include affordable units beyond the requirement voluntarily.
14. AR-25-29 : That the City Manager is requested to work with the School Department, the Department of Public Works, and other relevant departments to ensure that all city owned parking lots, with a focus on school complexes, including the still under construction parking at Tobin/Darby Vassal school complex, could be made available for after-hours use by residents.
15. AR-25-32 : That the City Manager is requested to meet with the leadership of the Harvard Square Business Association to discuss the proposal and to take the necessary steps to facilitate the release of $72,000 to fund the RFP development for the tunnel engineering study.
16. AR-25-33 : The City Manager is requested to work with relevant City departments to provide a legal opinion outlining, in light of current zoning including the most recent Multifamily Zoning Amendments, the ability of Cambridge to regulate institutional and religious uses in C-1 residential districts and what state and federal law allows in terms of local restrictions, if any, for institutional and religious uses.
Adjournment
